messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: EVENT RECORD: YT-5687-LM LOG DATE: 03/10/23  Incident at Pine Street Library - Event Type: Theft. Around 3:45 PM, Patrol Off. L. M. N. Ortiz reported a theft at the Pine Street Library. Witnesses: Mr. Gerald Winston and Miss. Beverly Knox. ALERT - IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUESTED BY: PROPERTY CRIME UNIT - URGENT INVESTIGATION!  Det. A. B. C. Thompson was at the scene alongside Criminalist Jane. Pine St. LIBRARY - 16:00 Stolen Books. Local citizens Mrs. Hartley and Sir. Ronald Fitz offered additional insights. Forensic Specialist Mark began analyzing fingerprints on site.  FAST FORWARD TO: PROPERTY CRIME UNIT 4 - CRIME NOTES [CIRCLE ONE] Criminalist Jane, Det. Thompson. ON DUTY: Patrol Off. Ortiz. ASSOCIATED MEMOS: Hartley, Eliza 34 Pine St, Westwood, Nevada 564-789. 00985. PINE ST. LIBRARY 16:30 Books Gone.  By 4:15 PM, Det. Thompson, with the help of Lt. D. E. F. Grant, gathered evidence and identified a potential suspect. Officer G. H. I. Walker and Officer J. K. L. Ray ensured the library's perimeter was secure. At 5:00 PM, the main suspect, known as Mr. Timothy Clark, was interrogated.  RELAY INFO TO: PROPERTY CRIME UNIT 4 - STATUS [TICK] Criminalist Jane, Officer Walker, Lt. Grant. HEAD OF INVESTIGATION: Det. Thompson. INCIDENT DETAILS (1) Stolen Books List (2) Witness Accounts (3) Interrogation Transcript (4) Fingerprint Analysis (5) CCTV Footage (6) Additional Clues HEAD INVESTIGATOR S. T. U. Vega P.C.U. 45.210 L12 4467 Winston, GERALD. REFERENCE: LOCATION: PHONE: 456-1234 INVESTIGATOR: L. Ortiz REFERENCE ID: YT-0056- 220 THEFT EVENT: 16:00 VERIFICATION CODE 99245 - RECORDED Lillian Waters DATE 04/10/23 TRANSMIT TO: PROPERTY CRIME UNIT.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Off. L. M. N. Ortiz  
Officer Context: Around 3:45 PM, Patrol Off. L. M. N. Ortiz reported a theft at the Pine Street Library.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Det. A. B. C. Thompson  
Officer Context: Det. A. B. C. Thompson was at the scene alongside Criminalist Jane.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Criminalist Jane  
Officer Context: Criminalist Jane was at the scene.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Forensic Specialist Mark  
Officer Context: Forensic Specialist Mark began analyzing fingerprints.  
Officer Role: Forensic Specialist 

Officer Name: Lt. D. E. F. Grant  
Officer Context: Lt. D. E. F. Grant gathered evidence and identified a potential suspect.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer G. H. I. Walker  
Officer Context: Officer G. H. I. Walker and Officer J. K. L. Ray ensured the library's perimeter was secure.  
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Officer J. K. L. Ray  
Officer Context: Officer G. H. I. Walker and Officer J. K. L. Ray ensured the library's perimeter was secure.  
Officer Role: Officer
